0P00000IMN.F.summary: The fund's objective is long term outperformance over the EONIA (Euro OverNight Index Average). To achieve this goal, the fund invests in a dynamically managed diversified portfolio of Equities, Fixed income and Collective Investment Schemes.

0P0000HKP2.F.summary:
The Sub-fund management strategy is discretionary and opportunistic. The UCITS takes positions on the bond and equity markets and on currencies. The Sub-fundâs objective is to seek absolute performance, decorrelated over the recommended investment period, on the main international equity and bond markets. In the context of its management, the Sub-fundâs target volatility will be 2% and may reach a maximum of 3%.
The Sub-fund is actively managed, which means that the Manager makes investment decisions with the aim of achieving the Sub-fund's objective and investment policy. This active management includes taking decisions related to asset selection, regional allocation, sectoral views and overall market exposure. The Manager is in no way limited by the composition of the benchmark index in the positioning of the portfolio, and the Sub-fund may not hold all the components of the benchmark index or indeed any of the components in question.

0P0000K8PN.F.summary: The fund's objective is long term outperformance over the EONIA (Euro OverNight Index Average). To achieve this goal, the fund invests in a dynamically managed diversified portfolio of Equities, Fixed income and Collective Investment Schemes.

0P0000RQ6N.L.short_name: GAM Star Fund plc - GAM Star Em
0P0000RQ6N.L.long_name: GAM Star Fund plc - GAM Star Emerging Market Rates Class Ordinary GBP Accumulation
0P0000RQ6N.L.summary: The investment objective of the Fund is to achieve absolute return regardless of market conditions through investment in a portfolio of local and hard currency bonds and other Fixed Income Securities from emerging markets worldwide.
0P0000RQ6N.L.manager_bio: Paul McNamara joined in 1997 from the Export Credits Guarantee Department, where he worked in a similar position. Paul holds a CFA and Master's Degree in Economics from the London School of Economics. After completing this in 1991, he spent three years lecturing at the University of Warsaw before returning to the UK to work as a macroeconomist in the Government Economic Service. Paul has 9 years' experience.

0P0000ULCT.F.long_name: LGT Alpha Generix Global Return UCITS Sub-Fund Class B EUR
0P0000ULCT.F.summary:
The investment objective of the Sub-Fund is to generate consistent long-term
capital appreciation with principles designed to minimize the risk of capital loss.
The objective is pursued through a rule-based strategy (the âPortfolioâ) designed
to capture a broad range of sources of returns typically generated over the long
term by a broad universe of alternative global macro strategies. Further details of
the global macro strategy are set out in the section headed "Investment Process of the Portfolio" in the Prospectus.
0P0000ULCT.F.manager_bio:
Stefan A. Muehlemann CEO, 20 years of relevant experience, with LGT since 2001, Swiss citizen
â¢ Combines deep experience in fundamental research on hedge fund strategies globally, portfolio management and SAA/TAA with emphasis on quality management, consistency & governance
â¢ Member of LGTâs âprincely portfolioâ GIM investment committee, previous head of hedge fund portfolio management LGT Capital Partners; hedge fund analyst with Julius Baer NY; master degree in economics from University of St. Gallen

0P0000VRIG.F.long_name: Odey Investment plc - Odey Odyssey Fund I EUR Acc
0P0000VRIG.F.summary: The investment objective of the Sub-Fund is to achieve long term capital appreciation. The Sub-Fund will seek to achieve its investment objective by investing in or taking exposures across a broad range of asset classes identified by the Investment Manager as asset classes which at a given time offer value as measured by their risk return profile, based on the Investment Managerâs assessment of the economic outlook.
0P0000VRIG.F.manager_bio: Before joining Odey in 2010, Tim spent 12 years at Barclays Capital as Managing Director and head of global asset allocation. Tim was editor and principal author of Barclays Capital's Equity Gilt Study and chief advisor to the bank's RADAR fund. Previously Tim worked at Moore Capital as a portfolio strategist and spent 10 years as a strategist and trader for Tokai Bank Europe, a proprietary trading boutique. Tim graduated in English Literature from Oriel College, Oxford in 1985.

0P000126D7.F.summary: The investment objective of the Fund is to generate long-term capital appreciation and capital preservation regardless of market direction from investments in global markets.
0P000126D7.F.manager_bio:
Lorenzo Di Mattia is the Founder and Chief Investment Officer at Sibilla Capital. Mr. Di Mattia has been trading and managing portfolios since 1992. He is responsible for Sibilla Capitalâs discretionary investment process, research, and investment models. In 2007, Mr. Di Mattia launched Sibilla Capital Ltd., a highly liquid discretionary global macro hedge fund supported by back-tested models he had developed over the prior decade. He is supported by a team of fundamental and quantitative analysts. 
Prior to launching Sibilla Capital, from 1996 to 2006, Mr. Di Mattia managed a series of managed accounts for selected clients. During this time, he achieved an average annualized return of 117.93% between 1996 and 2000 and 17.57% between 2000 and 2006 with no negative years*. From 1992 to 2000, as Mr. Di Mattia traded his own account principally in currencies, futures, and equities as he began to broaden the investment strategy and portfolio construction. During this time period, he began to develop a series of models which is the foundation for the models used today by Sibilla Capital.
Mr. Di Mattiaâs independent approach in the investment process and his dissensus views on Wall Street derives from his background as a âstudent of the markets.â Select academic coursework from New York University he has taken include Value Investing, Programming, Financial Statement Analysis, and Advanced Accounting. Mr. Di Mattia is both a CFAÂ® Charterholder and a Chartered Market Technician (CMT). Mr. Di Mattia graduated from Liceo Scentifico Luigi di Savoia with a focus on Math and Physics and attended Universita Politecnica Delle Marche studying engineering and modeling.

0P0001AJK9.F.long_name: TM Fulcrum Diversified Absolute Return Fund B EUR AccumulationHedged
0P0001AJK9.F.summary:
The investment objective of the Fund is to aim to achieve long-term absolute returns of inflation + 3% to 5% in all market conditions over rolling five year annualised periods, with lower volatility than equity markets. 
The Fund aims to achieve a positive return on a rolling three year basis. In seeking to achieve its investment goal, the Fund will hold a diversified portfolio, typically consisting of equities, fixed income, commodity related instruments and cash. Investments may be made through collective investment schemes (including absolute return funds, index funds such as exchange traded funds (ETFs) and actively managed funds). Indirect exposure to commodities may be sought through investment in transferable securities, eligible index derivatives and collective investment schemes. The Fund may use derivatives for investment purposes and for efficient portfolio management.
0P0001AJK9.F.manager_bio: Andrew Stevens is Chief Executive Officer. He was previously Executive Director at Goldman Sachs, Investment Management Division from 1992 to 2004. Andrew received an MBA from Harvard Business School in 1992.

AARM01.MI.long_name: Alessia - Absolute Return Macro Class Q
AARM01.MI.summary: The Sub-Fund seeks positive return with relative low volatility and limited correlation to market cycles affecting traditional equity and fixed income markets. This objective is reached investing in equity markets, fixed income, corporate bonds, foreign exchange and related financial derivative instruments. In order to achieve its objectives, the Sub-Fund bases its investment decisions on detailed analysis and research. The aim of this research is to look for unbalances in interest rates, equity values, foreign exchange rates and credit prices that will needed to be adjusted in the future.
